greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n, k) = qStirling1(n, k, q) for q = 2, with 0 <= k <= n.
formula: qStirling1(n, k, q) = qStirling1(n-1, k-1, q) + qBrackets(n-1, q)*qStirling1(n-1, k, q) with boundary values 0^k if n = 0 and n^0 if k = 0.
Note that also a second definition is used in the literature. The two versions differ by a factor of q^(n-k).
maple: qStirling1 := proc(n, k, q) option remember; with(QDifferenceEquations):
if n = 0 then return 0^k fi; if k = 0 then return n^0 fi;
qStirling1(n-1, k-1, p) + QBrackets(n-1, p)*qStirling1(n-1, k, p);
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Mar 09 2020
